about_the_game:
Use the cards in your hand to build a city where your residents are happy by supplying them with the buildings necessary for their survival. Relax with this challenge by building your city and placing the cards buildings with different effects in an optimal way for the residents.



You will have at your disposal a series of randomly generated cards with different buildings to construct. Each building has an area range that you must place correctly to prevent your population from decreasing.



At first you can exchange your cards for free, but later they will be worth happiness points that citizens give you by supplying different needs for houses and apartments.



The goal is to get as much population as you can by maintaining the houses and apartments. You have a limit of 100 days to achieve a series of objectives and succeed in beating The City Cards Challenge.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04
  • Processor: Dual core from Intel or AMD at 2.8 GHz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: nVidia GeForce 8600/9600GT, ATI/AMD Radeon HD2600/3600 (Graphic Drivers: nVidia 310, AMD 12.11), OpenGL 2.1
  • Storage: 200 MB available space

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:

  • Processor: 1.7 GHz Processor or better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8 or higher, ATI X1600 or higher, Intel HD 3000 or higher
  • Storage: 200 MB available space
